article.headline: California 69, Hampton 46
article.story: BERKELEY, Calif. (AP) -- Martin Smith's steady ballhandling and passing ability gave Richard Midgley some much-needed relief at the point guard position. In response, Midgley gave California's depleted lineup a big offensive lift. Midgley scored 25 points to lead the Golden Bears past Hampton 69-46 in the first round of the Golden Bear Classic on Wednesday night. Smith, a former walk-on, added career highs of 10 points and eight assists for Cal (6-3), which returned to action after an 11-day break for final exams. Smith's presence helped offset the absence of injured starter Ayinde Ubaka and Marquise Kately, who served a one-game suspension for failure to meet a team responsibility. "It's reassuring to have Martin Smith step up and keep us competitive," Cal coach Ben Braun said. "Martin has been a good complement to Richard." The Bears advanced to Thursday's title game against Pepperdine, a 91-82 winner over Arkansas State in Wednesday's opener. Kately will be back for Thursday's game. Braun provided few details on the disciplinary action he took with his team's leading rebounder, but said Kately acknowledged his mistake. "I think it's over with," Braun said. Hampton (3-7), which will face Arkansas State in the consolation game, was led by Devin Green with 15 and Brandon Streeter with 10 points and six rebounds. But the Pirates were held to 32.1 percent shooting and committed two second-half technicals and an intentional foul. Midgley converted all but three of his 12 free throws and went 7-for-11 from the floor as Cal shot 57.5 percent. Rod Benson and Dominic McGuire also scored 10 for the Bears. The Bears have won in the first round of this event in all 12 years of the tournament's existence, winning the title seven times -- most recently in 2002 over Louisiana-Lafayette. Green made two 3-pointers during a 10-2 Hampton run to start the second half and pull the Pirates within 36-33 with 15:03 left. But Midgley scored eight straight points as the Bears answered with a 19-5 run that made it 55-38. "I think our guys missed a couple defensive assignments and they got easy baskets," said Hampton coach Bobby Collins, who was called for a technical for arguing fouls. "My people know me pretty well. I'm a mild-mannered guy and don't even use profanity. I just thought our guys were getting hammered." Without Kately, the Bears only suited seven scholarship players because of injuries. Ubaka and Leon Powe are sidelined with injuries. Powe will likely miss the entire season as he recovers from reconstructive knee surgery, while Ubaka is expected back from a broken foot in mid-January. Smith knew he needed to play well. "I've always known I could do it," he said. "I have to communicate and make sure everyone is doing what they should do, and bring some continuity to the game." The Bears shot 52.4 percent in the first half and had just five fouls on the way to a 34-23 lead at the break. After trailing 16-5, Cal went on a 29-7 run to close out the half.

statistics.name: points
statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: fieldGoals
statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.name: freeThrows
statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.
